diff_analysis.evidence: The new nativeZip implementation builds a shell command string using unvalidated options.source and options.destination and executes it via cp.exec: `const command = `zip --quiet --recurse-paths ${options.destination} ${sources}`; const zipProcess = cp.exec(command, ...)`. Because exec invokes a shell, any special characters in user-controlled source/destination (e.g., `;`, `&&`, backticks) can break out of the intended zip command and inject arbitrary OS commands, constituting OS command injection (CWE-78). The old code used cp.spawn with an argument array, which avoided shell interpretation and was not vulnerable in this way.
